body:
I appreciate that but I want to reiterate my earlier point that in the
history of Go discourse adding type aliases has, to my best recollection,
never been mentioned until this month. There are plenty of things that
people are asking for, things that are blocking them writing Go programs
today, like your multidimensional slice proposal.

I don't see how adding a feature for Google's internal needs is the most
important change that could be made to the language.

On Wed, 20 Jul 2016, 00:03 Ian Lance Taylor <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @davecheney <https://github.com/davecheney> It's a fair argument, though
> I don't think Google's needs are unique here. I think what this is trying
> to address is a problem that arises in large scale refactoring. Google may
> be first to the problem, but others will encounter it as well. That's not
> to say that this the best or only solution, or that there needs to be a
> language-level solution at all. But I do think it's a real problem, and
> it's one that many other languages don't have. Go has chosen to uniquely
> identify types by a combination of import package name and exported name,
> and Go does not provide any form of type aliasing. Most other languages
> identify types by a simple name, and many provide some form of type
> aliasing.
